intro: Kixia scheffleri, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Kixia scheffleri is relatively hardy and can tolerate partial shade to full sun.
